## Histosols {#sec-key-hs .unnumbered}

Soils having one or more of the following:

1.  [*organic material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-orgm) starting ≤ 40 cm from the soil surface and having within 100 cm of the soil surface a combined thickness of:
    a.  ≥ 40 cm if \< 75% (by volume, related to the fine earth plus all dead plant remnants) consists of moss fibres; *or*
    b.  ≥ 60 cm; *or*
2.  [*organic material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-orgm) starting at the soil surface, having a thickness of ≥ 10 cm and directly overlying ice, [*continuous rock*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-contr) or [*technic hard material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-techhm); *or*
3.  a layer of coarse fragments that, together with overlying [*organic material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-orgm), if present, starts at the soil surface and has a thickness of
    a.  ≥ 10 cm if overlying [*continuous rock*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-contr) or [*technic hard material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-techhm); *or*
    b.  ≥ 40 cm;\
        \
        and the major part of the interstices between the coarse fragments is filled with [*organic material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-orgm) and the remaining interstices, if present, are void.

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" appearance="minimal" icon="false"}

## Anthrosols {#sec-key-at .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*hortic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-hortih), [*irragric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-iragh), [*plaggic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-plaggh) or [*terric horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-terich), ≥ 50 cm thick; *or*
2.  an [*anthraquic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-anthh) and an underlying [*hydragric horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-hydrh) with a combined thickness of ≥ 50 cm; *or*
3.  a [*pretic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-preth), the layers of which have a combined thickness of ≥ 50 cm, within 100 cm of the mineral soil surface.

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" appearance="minimal" icon="false"}

## Technosols {#sec-key-tc .unnumbered}

Other soils:

1.  with all of the following:
    a.  one or both of the following:
        i.  having ≥ 20% (by volume, weighted average, related to the whole soil) [*artefacts*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-artefm) in the upper 100 cm from the soil surface or to a limiting layer, whichever is shallower; *or*
        ii. having a layer, ≥ 10 cm thick and starting ≤ 50 cm from the soil surface, with ≥ 80% (by volume, related to the whole soil) [*artefacts*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-artefm); *and*
    b.  not having a layer containing [*artefacts*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-artefm) that qualifies as an [*argic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-argich), [*duric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-durich), [*ferralic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-feralh), [*ferric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-ferich), [*fragic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-fragh), [*hydragric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-hydrh), [*natric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-natrich), [*nitic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-nitich), [*petrocalcic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petroh), [*petroduric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petdh), [*petrogypsic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petrgh), [*petroplinthic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petplh), [*pisoplinthic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-pisoph), [*plinthic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-plinth), [*spodic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-spodh) or [*vertic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-verth) starting ≤ 100 cm from the soil surface, unless buried; *and*
    c.  not having a limiting layer, starting ≤ 10 cm from the soil surface; *or*
2.  having a continuous, very slowly permeable to impermeable, constructed geomembrane of any thickness or [*technic hard material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-techhm) starting ≤ 100 cm from the soil surface.

::: callout-note
Technosols may bury other soils, which can be mentioned behind the Technosol classification using the word 'over' in between (see [Chapter 2.4](chapter-02.qmd#sec-buried)). Alternatively, buried diagnostic horizons or buried layers with a diagnostic property can be indicated with the Thapto- specifier followed by a qualifier. The soil material above a geomembrane or [*technic hard material*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-techhm) may also be characterized by qualifiers. If the thickness or depth criteria of these qualifiers are not met, the Supra- specifier can be used (see [Chapter 2.3.2](chapter-02.qmd#sec-subq-defn)).
:::

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" appearance="minimal" icon="false"}

## Cryosols {#sec-key-cr .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*cryic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-cryich) starting ≤ 100 cm from the soil surface; *or*
2.  a [*cryic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-cryich) starting ≤ 200 cm from the soil surface *and*\
    evidence of cryogenic alteration (cryoturbation, frost heave, cryogenic sorting, thermal cracking, ice segregation, patterned ground, etc.) in some layer within 100 cm of the soil surface.

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" appearance="minimal" icon="false"}

## Leptosols {#sec-key-lp .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  one of the following:
    a.  [*continuous rock*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-contr) starting ≤ 25 cm from the soil surface; *or*
    b.  \< 20% (by volume, related to the whole soil) fine earth[^chapter-04-1], averaged over a depth of 75 cm from the soil surface or to [*continuous rock*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-contr), whichever is shallower; *and*
2.  no [*chernic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-chernh), [*duric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-durich), [*petrocalcic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petroh), [*petroduric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petdh), [*petrogypsic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petrgh)or [*spodic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-spodh).

[^chapter-04-1]: The volume not occupied by fine earth is occupied by coarse fragments or pores.

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" appearance="minimal" icon="false"}

## Solonetz {#sec-key-sn .unnumbered}

## Vertisols {#sec-key-vr .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*vertic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-verth) starting ≤ 100 cm from the mineral soil surface; *and*
2.  ≥ 30% clay between the mineral soil surface and the [*vertic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-verth) throughout; *and*
3.  [*shrink-swell cracks*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-shrswc) that start:
    a.  at the mineral soil surface; *or*
    b.  at the base of a plough layer; *or*
    c.  directly below a layer with strong granular structure or strong angular or subangular blocky structure with an aggregate size of ≤ 1 cm (self-mulching surface); *or*
    d.  directly below a surface crust; *and*\
        \
        extend to the [*vertic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-verth).

## Gleysols {#sec-key-gl .unnumbered}

Other soils having one or more of the following:

1.  a layer, ≥ 25 cm thick and starting ≤ 40 cm from the mineral soil surface, that has
    a.  [*gleyic properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-gleyicp) throughout; *and*
    b.  [*reducing conditions*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-reducc) in some parts of every sublayer; *or*
2.  both of the following:
    a.  a [*mollic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-mollh) or [*umbric horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-umbrich), \> 40 cm thick, that has [*reducing conditions*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-reducc) in some parts of every sublayer, from 40 cm below the mineral soil surface to the lower limit of the [*mollic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-mollh) or [*umbric horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-umbrich); *and*
    b.  directly underneath the [*mollic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-mollh)*/[umbric horizon](chapter-03.qmd#sec-umbrich)*, a layer, ≥ 10 cm thick, that has its lower limit ≥ 65 cm below the mineral soil surface, and that has:
        i.  [*gleyic properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-gleyicp) throughout; *and*
        ii. [*reducing conditions*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-reducc) in some parts of every sublayer; *or*
3.  permanent saturation by water starting ≤ 40 cm from the mineral soil surface.

## Andosols {#sec-key-an .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  one or more layers with [*andic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-andicp) or [*vitric properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-vitricp) with a combined thickness of:
    a.  ≥ 30 cm, within 100 cm of the soil surface and starting ≤ 25 cm from the soil surface; *or*
    b.  ≥ 60% of the entire thickness of the soil, if a limiting layer starts \> 25 and ≤ 50 cm from the soil surface; *and*
2.  no [*argic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-argich), [*ferralic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-feralh), [*petroplinthic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petplh), [*pisoplinthic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-pisoph), [*plinthic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-plinth) or [*spodic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-spodh) starting ≤ 100 cm of the soil surface, unless buried deeper than 50 cm from the mineral soil surface.

::: callout-note
Andosols may bury other soils, which can be mentioned behind the Andosol classification using the word 'over' in between (see [Chapter 2.4](chapter-02.qmd#sec-buried)). Alternatively, buried diagnostic horizons or buried layers with a diagnostic property can be indicated with the Thapto- specifier followed by a qualifier.
:::

## Planosols {#sec-key-pl .unnumbered}

Other soils having an [*abrupt textural difference*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-abtxdf) ≤ 75 cm from the mineral soil surface and having within the range of 5 cm directly above or below the [*abrupt textural difference*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-abtxdf):

1.  [*stagnic properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-stagnp), in which the area of reductimorphic features plus the area of oximorphic features is ≥ 50% (weighted average) of the total area; *and*
2.  [*reducing conditions*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-reducc) for some time during the year in some parts of the soil volume that has the reductimorphic features.

## Stagnosols {#sec-key-st .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  [*stagnic properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-stagnp), in which the area of reductimorphic features plus the area of oximorphic features is ≥ one third (weighted average) of the area from the mineral soil surface to a depth of 60 cm or to [*continuous rock*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-contr), whichever is shallower; *and*
2.  [*reducing conditions*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-reducc) for some time during the year in some parts of the soil volume that has the reductimorphic features within 60 cm from the mineral soil surface or to [*continuous rock*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-contr), whichever is shallower.

## Nitisols {#sec-key-nt .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*nitic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-nitich) starting ≤ 100 cm from the mineral soil surface; *and*
2.  from the mineral soil surface to the [*nitic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-nitich), a clay content that is at least half of the weighted average clay content of the [*nitic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-nitich); *and*
3.  no [*vertic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-verth) starting above or at the upper limit of the [*nitic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-nitich).

## Ferralsols {#sec-key-fr .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*ferralic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-feralh) starting ≤ 150 cm from the mineral soil surface; *and*
2.  no [*argic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-argich) starting above or at the upper limit of the [*ferralic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-feralh), unless the [*argic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-argich) has, in its upper 30 cm or throughout, whichever is shallower, one or more of the following:
    a.  \< 10% water-dispersible clay; *or*
    b.  a ΔpH (pH~KCl~ - pH~water~) ≥ 0 (both in 1:1 solution); *or*
    c.  ≥ 1.4% [*soil organic carbon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-soc).

## Chernozems {#sec-key-ch .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*chernic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-chernh); *and*
2.  starting ≤ 50 cm below the lower limit of the [*mollic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-mollh)[^chapter-04-2] and, if present, above a [*petrocalcic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-petroh), a layer with [*protocalcic properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-protcp), ≥ 5 cm thick, or a [*calcic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-calch); *and*
3.  a base saturation (by 1 *M* NH~4~OAc, pH 7)[^chapter-04-3] of ≥ 50% from the mineral soil surface to the layer with [*protocalcic properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-protcp) or to the [*calcic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-calch), throughout.

[^chapter-04-2]: Any [*chernic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-chernh) also meets the criteria of a [*mollic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-mollh). The [*mollic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-mollh) may extend below the [*chernic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-chernh).

[^chapter-04-3]: If the data for base saturation are not available, pH values may be used according to Annex 2 ([Chapter 9.13](annex-02-analytical-procedures.qmd#sec-a2-913)).

## Acrisols {#sec-key-ac .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  an [*argic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-argich) starting ≤ 100 cm from the mineral soil surface; *and*
2.  a CEC (by 1 *M* NH~4~OAc, pH 7) of \< 24 cmol~c~ kg^-1^ clay in some subhorizon of the [*argic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-argich) within 150 cm of the mineral soil surface; *and*
3.  exchangeable Al \> exchangeable (Ca+Mg+K+Na)[^chapter-04-6] in half or more of:
    a.  the depth range between 50 and 100 cm of the mineral soil surface; *or*
    b.  the lower half of the mineral soil above a limiting layer starting ≤ 100 cm from the mineral soil surface, whichever is shallower.

[^chapter-04-6]: Exchangeable cations are given in cmol~c~ kg^-1^. If these data are not available, pH values may be used according to Annex 2 ([Chapter 9.13](annex-02-analytical-procedures.qmd#sec-a2-913)).

## Cambisols {#sec-key-cm .unnumbered}

Other soils having:

1.  a [*cambic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-cambh)
    a.  a\. starting ≤ 50 cm from the mineral soil surface; *and*
    b.  having its lower limit ≥ 25 cm from the mineral soil surface; *or*
2.  an [*anthraquic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-anthh), [*hydragric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-hydrh), [*irragric*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-iragh), [*plaggic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-plaggh), [*pretic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-preth) or [*terric horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-terich); *or*
3.  a [*fragic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-fragh), [*thionic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-thionh) or [*vertic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-verth) starting ≤ 100 cm from the mineral soil surface; *or*
4.  a [*tsitelic horizon*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-tsith) with a texture class of sandy loam or finer, starting ≤ 50 cm from the mineral soil surface; *or*
5.  one or more layers with [*andic*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-andicp) or [*vitric properties*](chapter-03.qmd#sec-vitricp) with a combined thickness of ≥ 15 cm within 100 cm of the soil surface.

## Arenosols {#sec-key-ar .unnumbered}

Other soils having within 100 cm of the mineral soil surface:

1.  a weighted average texture class of loamy sand or sand; *and*
2.  layers of finer texture, if present, with a combined thickness of \< 15 cm; *and*
3.  layers with ≥ 40% (by volume, related to the whole soil) coarse fragments, if present, with a combined thickness of \< 15 cm.

::: callout-note
Arenosols may bury other soils, which can be mentioned behind the Arenosol classification using the word 'over' in between (see [Chapter 2.4](chapter-02.qmd#sec-buried)). Alternatively, buried diagnostic horizons or buried layers with a diagnostic property can be indicated with the Thapto- specifier followed by a qualifier. Arenosols may have diagnostic horizons at depths of \> 100 cm. These can be indicated with the Bathy- specifier followed by a qualifier, e.g. Bathyacric (\> 100 cm), Bathyspodic (\> 200 cm).
:::
